posts.post_content:
I prefer this to corrupt. It always felt wrong using [corrupt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=corrupt) to kill that small flier that is about to kill you when you feel that such an expensive card should only be used to kill giant rares, or players. This one gives you flexibility to use it earlier on problem creatures.  
 Also, it only needs black mana while corrupt needs basic swamps. So you can happily use this in a multicolor deck that has lots of black dual lands.
posts.html:
I prefer this to corrupt. It always felt wrong using corrupt to kill that small flier that is about to kill you when you feel that such an expensive card should only be used to kill giant rares, or players. This one gives you flexibility to use it earlier on problem creatures.
Also, it only needs black mana while corrupt needs basic swamps. So you can happily use this in a multicolor deck that has lots of black dual lands.

Posted By: Narim (7/9/2011 2:59:14 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Yeeeees, [Drain Life](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drain Life) is BACK!!!.
  
   
I really think a lot of people underestimate the usefulness of this card. I can't tell you how many times I've used it (Drain Life I mean) to get rid of a pesky 1/1 or 2/2 creature with some crazy ability early game because I just didn't happen to have a straight kill spell in my hand, or didn't want to use it (destroy effects are obsiously more powerful than just damage). And you gain some life in the process. Can also be a great finisher when you have 7 or 8 swamps on the baord.
  
   
Also, I just noticed, this is actually a little better than it's OG dad, it doesn't have the life gaining restirction limit, so if you have it, and have no other better use for your mana, you can slap a 2/2 creature for 5 or 6 damage and still gain 5 or 6 life. Sweet.
posts.html:

And you gain some life in the process. Can also be a great finisher when you have 7 or 8 swamps on the baord.

Also, I just noticed, this is actually a little better than it's OG dad, it doesn't have the life gaining restirction limit, so if you have it, and have no other better use for your mana, you can slap a 2/2 creature for 5 or 6 damage and still gain 5 or 6 life. Sweet.

Posted By: BastianQoU (7/16/2011 7:59:35 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
*I prefer Exsanguinate, even though it can't target creatures. Having a doom blade with 'gain x life' doesn't excite me too much. Still a better-than-decent card. 3.5/5*  
  
Comparing this straight-up to [Exsanguinate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exsanguinate) doesn't make a lot of sense to me. This one is a creature kill/lifegain in a pinch/possible finisher, while Exsanguinate is a multiplayer/lifegain in a pinch/possible finisher. There's some overlap, but what card you'll want to use is really dependent on the situation.   
  
Ironically, Exsanguinate is more splashable.

Ironically, Exsanguinate is more splashable.

Posted By: ObsceneMartyr (7/21/2011 6:14:22 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I love this card. I'll usually use it over [Corrupt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corrupt) as a finisher, if only because it works with things like [Cabal Coffers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cabal Coffers), [Bubbling Muck](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bubbling Muck), and [Nirkana Revenant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nirkana Revenant). In a multiplayer match, I'll use [Exsanguinate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exsanguinate) instead, but I prefer [Consume Spirit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Consume Spirit) in a duel because it can be used as a creature kill spell in a pinch.
posts.html:
I love this card. I'll usually use it over Corrupt as a finisher, if only because it works with things like Cabal Coffers, Bubbling Muck, and Nirkana Revenant. In a multiplayer match, I'll use Exsanguinate instead, but I prefer Consume Spirit in a duel because it can be used as a creature kill spell in a pinch.

There is not such thing as a basic swamp, there are swamps. There might be lands which have swamp as the subtype but those are not swamps.  
  
Also this card is only good when you have tons of black mana. Not to be obvious but that's a big drawback.
